snippet: The arrests in southern China have prompted concern that a crackdown on civil society initiated by President Xi Jinping earlier this year may be broadening.
abstract: Chinese authorities have detained three labor leaders connected to recent unrest at factories in southern China; activists worry crackdown signals government is opening new front in repression of dissent.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Hong Kong, and Chris Buckley from Beijing. Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The arrests in southern China have prompted concern that a crackdown on civil society initiated by President Xi Jinping earlier this year may be broadening.

headline.main: China Arrests at Least 3 Workers’ Rights Leaders Amid Rising Unrest
headline.print_headline: China Arrests 3 Labor Activists Amid Unrest
